post_text: Paul Martin Newby, Senior Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of North Carolina, visited The Roger Bacon Academy!
shared_text:
The Roger Bacon Academy
March 5 at 10:56 AM ·

Paul Martin Newby, Senior Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of North Carolina, visited The Roger Bacon Academy to speak with Headmaster Laurie Benton and eighth grade history teacher Jorden Ochoa. They discussed teaching the development of our Constitution, separation of powers, and the proper role of the judiciary. Ms. Ochoa emphasized the importance The Roger Bacon Academy curriculum places on these topics and how vital they are to the growth of our students as citizens.

Parents, Guardians and Volunteers:

We are in need of volunteers to proctor for the End-Of-Grade (EOG) Test. As you know, these tests are given at the end of the year and take the cooperation of many people to complete successfully. We truly could not do this without parental and community support.

Testing dates are as follows: May 23rd Reading EOG, Friday May 24th Math EOG, and Tuesday May 28th Science EOG.

Proctors should arrive on campus at 7:45am and be prepared to stay until 12:00 although most testing is completed before that time. If you are able to help we would greatly appreciate it! Please contact me at badams@rogerbacon.net to sign up.

Thank you in advance!
